pages.text: Some time ago, one of our research teams stationed at an abandoned End City started excavating the area. They discovered an underground material, akin to Purpur, but archaic in a way.$(br2)This discovery became the basis for our research on the Ancients, and, by extent, this almanac.

When aiming to find these remnants, you do not have to clear out a hostile End City, but they do contain valuable resources. You might not even need to come close: remnants are scattered around the cities in an at least 40-meter radius.$(br2)Our teams have found that explosives are a viable form of excavation, but they are a bit of a risk as the remnants are unstable.

pages.title: Uncovered Remnants
pages.text: An illustration of some exposed Purpur Remnants.

Purpur Remnants are encased in a thick layer of End Stone that has built up over many millenia. Their dark-purple figure has been well-preserved, however, so you can spot them with ease.$(br2)Mining remnants yields $(item)Remnant Chunks$() and $(item)Impure Preserved Dust$(); you can gather more of the former with good fortune.$(br2)This handbook hinges upon your obtaining a substantial quantity of both.
